# conforms(to:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver conforms to a given protocol.

## Declaration

```swift
func conforms(to aProtocol: Protocol) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **aProtocol**: A protocol object that represents a particular protocol.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the receiver conforms to `aProtocol`, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

This method works identically to the [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/conforms(to:)] class method declared in [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class]. It’s provided as a convenience so that you don’t need to get the class object to find out whether an instance can respond to a given set of messages.

## Testing Object Inheritance, Behavior, and Conformance

- **isKind(of:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is an instance of given class or an instance of any class that inherits from that class.
- **isMember(of:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is an instance of a given class.
- **responds(to:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver implements or inherits a method that can respond to a specified message.
